title: Ensure white (non-black) background by default across the site

requirements.text: Make the site load with a white/light background by default (not a black/dark background), regardless of the userâ€™s OS/system color scheme, while keeping the existing white + pink aesthetic intact.

quotes: Don't use black background I want white background to look more asthetic

acceptanceCriteria: On a fresh visit (no existing theme in localStorage), the homepage background renders as a light/white theme even if the device OS is set to dark mode.
The top-level page background and all main sections (Header, Hero, Categories, Trending, Newsletter, Footer) do not render with a black/near-black background in the default theme.
The theme preference persists as before (if a user explicitly toggles theme, that preference is respected on reload).
No user-facing text is changed away from English as part of this update.

requirements.text: Audit and remove/replace any hard-coded dark/black background classes in homepage components so that light mode consistently uses the Tailwind theme tokens (e.g., bg-background, bg-card, muted variants) rather than black/dark colors.

quotes: Don't use black background I want white background to look more asthetic

acceptanceCriteria: A code search finds no use of hard-coded black/dark background utility classes (e.g., bg-black, bg-zinc-900, bg-neutral-950) in the homepage components that would affect the default (light) appearance.
Light mode backgrounds across the homepage visually read as white with soft pink accents, consistent with the existing CSS variable theme tokens.

constraints: Keep all user-facing text in English.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose them instead).
Do not edit any frontend immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Removing the dark mode feature entirely.
Changing homepage content, product lists, or branding beyond what is necessary to ensure the default background is white/light.
